SENT.plain: We report a case of a 26- year old woman having antiphospholipid syndrome in pregnancy with long-term follow up
She presented with recurrent miscarriages, venous thrombosis, avascular necrosis of femoral head, mid-cerebral artery infarction and skin ulcers
Antiphospholipid syndrome is a recognized disorder of pregnancy
Diagnosis requires a high index of suspicion when evaluating women with recurrent pregnancy losses and vascular thrombosis
A low dose aspirin combined with heparin can reduce morbidity and improves the pregnancy outcome
